Looks interesting. Its pretty clear to me now that using dependencies in te=
st cases is a good thing. I still hope the JUnit architects will be convinc=
ed of this one day. 

But we have still to use JUnit 3.8.1.

Can you make J=
Example compatible for JUnit 3.8.x?
